events.originalText: A sightseeing helicopter crashed in the mountains of Skoddevarre in Alta, Norway, killing all six people on board.
events.subtitle: 2019 Alta helicopter crash
events.headline: Helicopter crash in Skoddevarre, Alta, Norway kills all six on board

events.originalText: Brazilian president Dilma Rousseff was removed from office following her impeachment on charges of criminal administrative misconduct.
events.subtitle: Dilma Rousseff
events.headline: Brazilian president Dilma Rousseff impeached on charges of criminal administrative misconduct

events.originalText: Typhoon Rusa made landfall in Goheung as the most powerful typhoon to hit South Korea in 43 years, killing at least 236 people.
events.subtitle: Typhoon Rusa
events.headline: Typhoon Rusa hits Goheung, South Korea, killing at least 236 people

events.originalText: Diana, Princess of Wales (pictured), her partner Dodi Fayed, and their driver were killed in a car crash in Paris.
events.subtitle: Diana, Princess of Wales
events.headline: Princess Diana, partner Dodi Fayed, and driver killed in Paris car crash

events.originalText: On the final day of the Isle of Wight Festival 1969, an event attended by approximately 150,000 people over three days, Bob Dylan appeared in his first gig in three years.
events.subtitle: Isle of Wight Festival 1969
events.headline: Bob Dylan performs at Isle of Wight Festival 1969

events.originalText: A parcel bomb sent by Ngô Đình Nhu, younger brother and chief adviser of South Vietnamese president Ngô Đình Diệm, failed to kill Norodom Sihanouk, Prime Minister of Cambodia.
events.subtitle: Letter bomb
events.headline: Parcel bomb sent by Ngô Đình Nhu fails to kill Norodom Sihanouk

events.originalText: The Matagorda hurricane, the most intense and costliest tropical cyclone of the 1942 Atlantic hurricane season, dissipated after causing $26.5 million in damages and eight deaths.
events.subtitle: 1942 Matagorda hurricane
events.headline: Matagorda hurricane causes $26.5 million in damages and eight deaths

events.originalText: World War II: A detachment of Chetniks captured the town of Loznica in German-occupied Serbia.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Chetniks capture town of Loznica in German-occupied Serbia

events.originalText: Second World War: Two Royal navy destroyers were lost to mines and two other vessels damaged off Texel, Netherlands, killing around 300 men.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Royal navy destroyers lost to mines off Texel, Netherlands, killing around 300 men

events.originalText: Nazi forces, posing as Poles, staged an attack against the German radio station Sender Gleiwitz in Gleiwitz, Upper Silesia, Germany, creating an excuse to invade Poland the next day.
events.subtitle: Gleiwitz incident
events.headline: Nazi forces stage attack on German radio station in Gleiwitz, Germany

events.originalText: Russia and the United Kingdom signed the Anglo-Russian Convention, defining their respective spheres of interest in Persia, Afghanistan, and Tibet.
events.subtitle: Anglo-Russian Convention
events.headline: Russia and UK sign Anglo-Russian Convention defining spheres of interest

events.originalText: Thomas Edison was granted a patent for the Kinetoscope, a precursor to the modern movie projector.
events.subtitle: Thomas Edison
events.headline: Thomas Edison granted patent for Kinetoscope

events.originalText: The body of Mary Ann Nichols, the alleged first victim of an unidentified serial killer known as Jack the Ripper (depicted), was found in Buck's Row, London.
events.subtitle: Mary Ann Nichols
events.headline: Body of Jack the Ripper's alleged first victim found in London

events.originalText: Sultan Murad V of the Ottoman Empire was deposed after a reign of 93 days on grounds of mental illness.
events.subtitle: Murad V
events.headline: Sultan Murad V of Ottoman Empire deposed after 93-day reign

events.originalText: Al-Kamil became the fourth sultan of the Ayyubid dynasty of Egypt.
events.subtitle: Al-Kamil
events.headline: Al-Kamil becomes fourth sultan of Ayyubid dynasty of Egypt
